PARAGRAPH.STRING: (pronounced /ʃɨˈʃældən/) is a moderately active volcano on Unimak Island in the Aleutian Islands chain of Alaska.
is a rather symmetric cone, reminiscent of Mount Fuji, with several smaller, low-profile cones scattered on the Northwest slope. Rising to 2857 m (9,373 ft) above sea level
is the third largest island based volcano in North America and one of the most active volcanoes in the Aleutian Range.
